intro: Octospermum pleiogynum, commonly known as the manyfemale octospermum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its unique floral structure. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with multiple female organs, which is reflected in its scientific name. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and reproductive biology.
